plot: Lisa's imaginary friend is a depressed British singer from the 1980s; Homer becomes a truck guy.

After being belittled by her classmates, Lisa finds solace from a singer from the '80s. Lisa and Quilloughby both share a love for vegetarian food. However, Lisa starts following her imaginary friend's advice, she becomes a rebel and she starts mocking the people who have belittled her earlier. Marge soon cancels Lisa's music subscription to Slapify. Lisa soon rebels against her mother and she steals her father's credit card so that she can go to an upcoming Quilloughby concert. By the time Lisa goes to the concert, she sees the real Quilloughby and she discovers that her favorite singer has become an overweight meat eater and a racist individual. Imaginary Quilloughby advises Lisa not to become like he is today and he tells her that she should try to listen to her loved ones. Imaginary Quilloughby bids goodbye to Lisa and he disappears into her pin. The concert attendees soon knock out the real Quilloughby. Marge is able to save Lisa and she apologizes to her mother for how she has acted. Marge assures Lisa she has went through her teenage years and she has gotten into disagreements with her mother. Marge tells Lisa she will still be there for her, they share a tender moment while Homer drives his family home on his truck.—dawsonpersi
